columns.text: For this problem, we will deal with the concept effective annual interest in determining the cost of borrowing.

The effective annual interest uses the compounding effects of an interest-paying investment to determine the real rate of return. It can be used to compare the interest between investments with different rates.

**b.)** For this, we will first solve for the amount of the commitment fee which is $0.25\%$ of the amount borrowed.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Commitment Fee}&=\$115,000,000 \times 0.0025\\[15 pt]
&=\$287,500
\end{aligned}$$

The commitment fee for this is $\$287,500$

Aside from the commitment fee, we will also solve for the interest for the borrowed funds using the effective interest rate we solved in the previous part of this problem. 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Interest}&=\$115,000,000 \times 0.0797\\[15 pt]
&=\$9,165,500
\end{aligned}$$

Using the effective annual interest rate, the interest for this loan is $\$9,165,500$

Now, we can solve for the total interest by adding the compensation fee and the interest in Step 5.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total interest}&=\$287,500+\$9,165,500\\[15 pt]
&=\$9,453,000
\end{aligned}$$

From the total interest, we can divide this by the amount borrowed to get the effective interest rate:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Effective Annual Interest}&=\dfrac{\$9,453,000}{\$115,000,000}\\[15 pt]
&=0.0822
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the Effective Annual Interest is $0.0822$ or $8.22\%$
